scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: In sooth, I know not why I am so sad:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: It wearies me; you say it wearies you;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: But how I caught it, found it, or came by it,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: What stuff 'tis made of, whereof it is born,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I am to learn;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And such a want-wit sadness makes of me,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: That I have much ado to know myself.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Your mind is tossing on the ocean;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: There, where your argosies with portly sail,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Like signiors and rich burghers on the flood,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Or, as it were, the pageants of the sea,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Do overpeer the petty traffickers,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: That curtsy to them, do them reverence,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: As they fly by them with their woven wings.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Believe me, sir, had I such venture forth,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: The better part of my affections would

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Be with my hopes abroad. I should be still

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Plucking the grass, to know where sits the wind,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Peering in maps for ports and piers and roads;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: And every object that might make me fear

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Misfortune to my ventures, out of doubt

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Would make me sad.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: My wind cooling my broth

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Would blow me to an ague, when I thought

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: What harm a wind too great at sea might do.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: I should not see the sandy hour-glass run,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: But I should think of shallows and of flats,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And see my wealthy Andrew dock'd in sand,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Vailing her high-top lower than her ribs

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: To kiss her burial. Should I go to church

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And see the holy edifice of stone,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And not bethink me straight of dangerous rocks,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Which touching but my gentle vessel's side,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Would scatter all her spices on the stream,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Enrobe the roaring waters with my silks,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And, in a word, but even now worth this,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And now worth nothing? Shall I have the thought

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: To think on this, and shall I lack the thought

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: That such a thing bechanced would make me sad?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: But tell not me; I know, Antonio

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Is sad to think upon his merchandise.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Believe me, no: I thank my fortune for it,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: My ventures are not in one bottom trusted,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Nor to one place; nor is my whole estate

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Upon the fortune of this present year:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Therefore my merchandise makes me not sad.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Why, then you are in love.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Fie, fie!

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Not in love neither? Then let us say you are sad,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Because you are not merry: and 'twere as easy

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: For you to laugh and leap and say you are merry,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Because you are not sad. Now, by two-headed Janus,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Nature hath framed strange fellows in her time:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Some that will evermore peep through their eyes

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And laugh like parrots at a bag-piper,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And other of such vinegar aspect

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: That they'll not show their teeth in way of smile,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Though Nestor swear the jest be laughable.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Here comes Bassanio, your most noble kinsman,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Gratiano and Lorenzo. Fare ye well:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: We leave you now with better company.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: I would have stay'd till I had made you merry,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: If worthier friends had not prevented me.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Your worth is very dear in my regard.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I take it, your own business calls on you

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And you embrace the occasion to depart.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Good morrow, my good lords.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Good signiors both, when shall we laugh? say, when?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: You grow exceeding strange: must it be so?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: We'll make our leisures to attend on yours.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: My Lord Bassanio, since you have found Antonio,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: We two will leave you: but at dinner-time,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: I pray you, have in mind where we must meet.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I will not fail you.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: You look not well, Signior Antonio;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: You have too much respect upon the world:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: They lose it that do buy it with much care:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Believe me, you are marvellously changed.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I hold the world but as the world, Gratiano;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: A stage where every man must play a part,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And mine a sad one.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Let me play the fool:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: With mirth and laughter let old wrinkles come,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: And let my liver rather heat with wine

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Than my heart cool with mortifying groans.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Why should a man, whose blood is warm within,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Sit like his grandsire cut in alabaster?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Sleep when he wakes and creep into the jaundice

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: By being peevish? I tell thee what, Antonio--

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: I love thee, and it is my love that speaks--

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: There are a sort of men whose visages

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Do cream and mantle like a standing pond,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: And do a wilful stillness entertain,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: With purpose to be dress'd in an opinion

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Of wisdom, gravity, profound conceit,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: As who should say 'I am Sir Oracle,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: And when I ope my lips let no dog bark!'

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: O my Antonio, I do know of these

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: That therefore only are reputed wise

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: For saying nothing; when, I am very sure,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: If they should speak, would almost damn those ears,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Which, hearing them, would call their brothers fools.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: I'll tell thee more of this another time:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: But fish not, with this melancholy bait,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: For this fool gudgeon, this opinion.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Come, good Lorenzo. Fare ye well awhile:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: I'll end my exhortation after dinner.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Well, we will leave you then till dinner-time:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: I must be one of these same dumb wise men,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: For Gratiano never lets me speak.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Well, keep me company but two years moe,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Thou shalt not know the sound of thine own tongue.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Farewell: I'll grow a talker for this gear.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Thanks, i' faith, for silence is only commendable

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: In a neat's tongue dried and a maid not vendible.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Is that any thing now?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Gratiano speaks an infinite deal of nothing, more

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: than any man in all Venice. His reasons are as two

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: grains of wheat hid in two bushels of chaff: you

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: shall seek all day ere you find them, and when you

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: have them, they are not worth the search.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Well, tell me now what lady is the same

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: To whom you swore a secret pilgrimage,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: That you to-day promised to tell me of?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: 'Tis not unknown to you, Antonio,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: How much I have disabled mine estate,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: By something showing a more swelling port

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Than my faint means would grant continuance:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Nor do I now make moan to be abridged

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: From such a noble rate; but my chief care

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Is to come fairly off from the great debts

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Wherein my time something too prodigal

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Hath left me gaged. To you, Antonio,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I owe the most, in money and in love,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And from your love I have a warranty

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: To unburden all my plots and purposes

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: How to get clear of all the debts I owe.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I pray you, good Bassanio, let me know it;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And if it stand, as you yourself still do,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Within the eye of honour, be assured,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: My purse, my person, my extremest means,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Lie all unlock'd to your occasions.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: In my school-days, when I had lost one shaft,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I shot his fellow of the self-same flight

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: The self-same way with more advised watch,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: To find the other forth, and by adventuring both

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I oft found both: I urge this childhood proof,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Because what follows is pure innocence.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I owe you much, and, like a wilful youth,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: That which I owe is lost; but if you please

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: To shoot another arrow that self way

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Which you did shoot the first, I do not doubt,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: As I will watch the aim, or to find both

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Or bring your latter hazard back again

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And thankfully rest debtor for the first.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: You know me well, and herein spend but time

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: To wind about my love with circumstance;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And out of doubt you do me now more wrong

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: In making question of my uttermost

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Than if you had made waste of all I have:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Then do but say to me what I should do

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: That in your knowledge may by me be done,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And I am prest unto it: therefore, speak.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: In Belmont is a lady richly left;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And she is fair, and, fairer than that word,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Of wondrous virtues: sometimes from her eyes

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I did receive fair speechless messages:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Her name is Portia, nothing undervalued

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: To Cato's daughter, Brutus' Portia:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Nor is the wide world ignorant of her worth,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: For the four winds blow in from every coast

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Renowned suitors, and her sunny locks

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Hang on her temples like a golden fleece;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Which makes her seat of Belmont Colchos' strand,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And many Jasons come in quest of her.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: O my Antonio, had I but the means

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: To hold a rival place with one of them,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I have a mind presages me such thrift,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: That I should questionless be fortunate!

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Thou know'st that all my fortunes are at sea;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Neither have I money nor commodity

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: To raise a present sum: therefore go forth;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Try what my credit can in Venice do:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: That shall be rack'd, even to the uttermost,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: To furnish thee to Belmont, to fair Portia.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Go, presently inquire, and so will I,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Where money is, and I no question make

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: To have it of my trust or for my sake.

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: By my troth, Nerissa, my little body is aweary of

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: this great world.

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: You would be, sweet madam, if your miseries were in

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: the same abundance as your good fortunes are: and

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: yet, for aught I see, they are as sick that surfeit

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: with too much as they that starve with nothing. It

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: is no mean happiness therefore, to be seated in the

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: mean: superfluity comes sooner by white hairs, but

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: competency lives longer.

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Good sentences and well pronounced.

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: They would be better, if well followed.

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: If to do were as easy as to know what were good to

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: do, chapels had been churches and poor men's

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: cottages princes' palaces. It is a good divine that

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: follows his own instructions: I can easier teach

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: twenty what were good to be done, than be one of the

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: twenty to follow mine own teaching. The brain may

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: devise laws for the blood, but a hot temper leaps

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: o'er a cold decree: such a hare is madness the

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: youth, to skip o'er the meshes of good counsel the

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: cripple. But this reasoning is not in the fashion to

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: choose me a husband. O me, the word 'choose!' I may

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: neither choose whom I would nor refuse whom I

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: dislike; so is the will of a living daughter curbed

scene: SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: by the will of a dead father. Is it not hard,
