speaker: GOBBO
line: but, I pray you, tell me, is my boy, God rest his

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: soul, alive or dead?

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Do you not know me, father?

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: Alack, sir, I am sand-blind; I know you not.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Nay, indeed, if you had your eyes, you might fail of

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: the knowing me: it is a wise father that knows his

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: own child. Well, old man, I will tell you news of

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: your son: give me your blessing: truth will come

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: to light; murder cannot be hid long; a man's son

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: may, but at the length truth will out.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: Pray you, sir, stand up: I am sure you are not

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: Launcelot, my boy.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Pray you, let's have no more fooling about it, but

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: give me your blessing: I am Launcelot, your boy

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: that was, your son that is, your child that shall

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: be.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: I cannot think you are my son.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: I know not what I shall think of that: but I am

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Launcelot, the Jew's man, and I am sure Margery your

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: wife is my mother.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: Her name is Margery, indeed: I'll be sworn, if thou

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: be Launcelot, thou art mine own flesh and blood.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: Lord worshipped might he be! what a beard hast thou

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: got! thou hast got more hair on thy chin than

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: Dobbin my fill-horse has on his tail.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: It should seem, then, that Dobbin's tail grows

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: backward: I am sure he had more hair of his tail

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: than I have of my face when I last saw him.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: Lord, how art thou changed! How dost thou and thy

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: master agree? I have brought him a present. How

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: 'gree you now?

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Well, well: but, for mine own part, as I have set

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: up my rest to run away, so I will not rest till I

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: have run some ground. My master's a very Jew: give

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: him a present! give him a halter: I am famished in

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: his service; you may tell every finger I have with

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: my ribs. Father, I am glad you are come: give me

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: your present to one Master Bassanio, who, indeed,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: gives rare new liveries: if I serve not him, I

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: will run as far as God has any ground. O rare

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: fortune! here comes the man: to him, father; for I

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: am a Jew, if I serve the Jew any longer.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: You may do so; but let it be so hasted that supper

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: be ready at the farthest by five of the clock. See

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: these letters delivered; put the liveries to making,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: and desire Gratiano to come anon to my lodging.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: To him, father.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: God bless your worship!

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Gramercy! wouldst thou aught with me?

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: Here's my son, sir, a poor boy,--

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Not a poor boy, sir, but the rich Jew's man; that

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: would, sir, as my father shall specify--

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: He hath a great infection, sir, as one would say, to serve--

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Indeed, the short and the long is, I serve the Jew,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: and have a desire, as my father shall specify--

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: His master and he, saving your worship's reverence,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: are scarce cater-cousins--

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: To be brief, the very truth is that the Jew, having

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: done me wrong, doth cause me, as my father, being, I

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: hope, an old man, shall frutify unto you--

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: I have here a dish of doves that I would bestow upon

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: your worship, and my suit is--

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: In very brief, the suit is impertinent to myself, as

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: your worship shall know by this honest old man; and,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: though I say it, though old man, yet poor man, my father.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: One speak for both. What would you?

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Serve you, sir.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GOBBO
line: That is the very defect of the matter, sir.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I know thee well; thou hast obtain'd thy suit:

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Shylock thy master spoke with me this day,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And hath preferr'd thee, if it be preferment

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: To leave a rich Jew's service, to become

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: The follower of so poor a gentleman.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: The old proverb is very well parted between my

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: master Shylock and you, sir: you have the grace of

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: God, sir, and he hath enough.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Thou speak'st it well. Go, father, with thy son.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Take leave of thy old master and inquire

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: My lodging out. Give him a livery

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: More guarded than his fellows': see it done.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Father, in. I cannot get a service, no; I have

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: ne'er a tongue in my head. Well, if any man in

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Italy have a fairer table which doth offer to swear

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: upon a book, I shall have good fortune. Go to,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: here's a simple line of life: here's a small trifle

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: of wives: alas, fifteen wives is nothing! eleven

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: widows and nine maids is a simple coming-in for one

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: man: and then to 'scape drowning thrice, and to be

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: in peril of my life with the edge of a feather-bed;

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: here are simple scapes. Well, if Fortune be a

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: woman, she's a good wench for this gear. Father,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: come; I'll take my leave of the Jew in the twinkling of an eye.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I pray thee, good Leonardo, think on this:

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: These things being bought and orderly bestow'd,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Return in haste, for I do feast to-night

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: My best-esteem'd acquaintance: hie thee, go.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LEONARDO
line: My best endeavours shall be done herein.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Where is your master?

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: LEONARDO
line: Yonder, sir, he walks.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Signior Bassanio!

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Gratiano!

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: I have a suit to you.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: You have obtain'd it.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: You must not deny me: I must go with you to Belmont.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Why then you must. But hear thee, Gratiano;

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Thou art too wild, too rude and bold of voice;

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Parts that become thee happily enough

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And in such eyes as ours appear not faults;

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: But where thou art not known, why, there they show

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Something too liberal. Pray thee, take pain

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: To allay with some cold drops of modesty

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Thy skipping spirit, lest through thy wild behavior

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I be misconstrued in the place I go to,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And lose my hopes.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Signior Bassanio, hear me:

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: If I do not put on a sober habit,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Talk with respect and swear but now and then,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Wear prayer-books in my pocket, look demurely,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Nay more, while grace is saying, hood mine eyes

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Thus with my hat, and sigh and say 'amen,'

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Use all the observance of civility,

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Like one well studied in a sad ostent

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: To please his grandam, never trust me more.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Well, we shall see your bearing.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Nay, but I bar to-night: you shall not gauge me

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: By what we do to-night.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: No, that were pity:

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I would entreat you rather to put on

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Your boldest suit of mirth, for we have friends

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: That purpose merriment. But fare you well:

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I have some business.

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: And I must to Lorenzo and the rest:

scene: SCENE II.  Venice. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: But we will visit you at supper-time.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: I am sorry thou wilt leave my father so:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Our house is hell, and thou, a merry devil,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Didst rob it of some taste of tediousness.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: But fare thee well, there is a ducat for thee:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: And, Launcelot, soon at supper shalt thou see

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Lorenzo, who is thy new master's guest:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Give him this letter; do it secretly;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: And so farewell: I would not have my father

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: See me in talk with thee.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Adieu! tears exhibit my tongue. Most beautiful

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: pagan, most sweet Jew! if a Christian did not play

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: the knave and get thee, I am much deceived. But,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: adieu: these foolish drops do something drown my

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: manly spirit: adieu.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Farewell, good Launcelot.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Alack, what heinous sin is it in me

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: To be ashamed to be my father's child!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: But though I am a daughter to his blood,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: I am not to his manners. O Lorenzo,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: If thou keep promise, I shall end this strife,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Become a Christian and thy loving wife.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Nay, we will slink away in supper-time,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Disguise us at my lodging and return,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: All in an hour.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: We have not made good preparation.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: We have not spoke us yet of torchbearers.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: 'Tis vile, unless it may be quaintly order'd,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: And better in my mind not undertook.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: 'Tis now but four o'clock: we have two hours

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: To furnish us.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Friend Launcelot, what's the news?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: An it shall please you to break up

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: this, it shall seem to signify.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: I know the hand: in faith, 'tis a fair hand;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And whiter than the paper it writ on

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Is the fair hand that writ.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Love-news, in faith.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: By your leave, sir.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Whither goest thou?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Marry, sir, to bid my old master the

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Jew to sup to-night with my new master the Christian.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Hold here, take this: tell gentle Jessica

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: I will not fail her; speak it privately.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Go, gentlemen,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Will you prepare you for this masque tonight?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: I am provided of a torch-bearer.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Ay, marry, I'll be gone about it straight.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: And so will I.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Meet me and Gratiano

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: At Gratiano's lodging some hour hence.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: 'Tis good we do so.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Was not that letter from fair Jessica?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: I must needs tell thee all. She hath directed

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: How I shall take her from her father's house,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: What gold and jewels she is furnish'd with,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: What page's suit she hath in readiness.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: If e'er the Jew her father come to heaven,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: It will be for his gentle daughter's sake:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And never dare misfortune cross her foot,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Unless she do it under this excuse,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: That she is issue to a faithless Jew.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Come, go with me; peruse this as thou goest:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. A street.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Fair Jessica shall be my torch-bearer.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Well, thou shalt see, thy eyes shall be thy judge,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: The difference of old Shylock and Bassanio:--

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: What, Jessica!--thou shalt not gormandise,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: As thou hast done with me:--What, Jessica!--

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: And sleep and snore, and rend apparel out;--

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Why, Jessica, I say!

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Why, Jessica!

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Who bids thee call? I do not bid thee call.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Your worship was wont to tell me that

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: I could do nothing without bidding.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Call you? what is your will?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: I am bid forth to supper, Jessica:

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: There are my keys. But wherefore should I go?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: I am not bid for love; they flatter me:

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: But yet I'll go in hate, to feed upon

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: The prodigal Christian. Jessica, my girl,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Look to my house. I am right loath to go:

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: There is some ill a-brewing towards my rest,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: For I did dream of money-bags to-night.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: I beseech you, sir, go: my young master doth expect

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: your reproach.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: So do I his.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: An they have conspired together, I will not say you

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: shall see a masque; but if you do, then it was not

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: for nothing that my nose fell a-bleeding on

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Black-Monday last at six o'clock i' the morning,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: falling out that year on Ash-Wednesday was four

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: year, in the afternoon.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: What, are there masques? Hear you me, Jessica:

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Lock up my doors; and when you hear the drum

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: And the vile squealing of the wry-neck'd fife,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Clamber not you up to the casements then,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Nor thrust your head into the public street

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: To gaze on Christian fools with varnish'd faces,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: But stop my house's ears, I mean my casements:

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Let not the sound of shallow foppery enter

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: My sober house. By Jacob's staff, I swear,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: I have no mind of feasting forth to-night:

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: But I will go. Go you before me, sirrah;

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Say I will come.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: I will go before, sir. Mistress, look out at

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: window, for all this, There will come a Christian

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: boy, will be worth a Jewess' eye.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: What says that fool of Hagar's offspring, ha?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: His words were 'Farewell mistress;' nothing else.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: The patch is kind enough, but a huge feeder;

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Snail-slow in profit, and he sleeps by day

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: More than the wild-cat: drones hive not with me;

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Therefore I part with him, and part with him

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: To one that would have him help to waste

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: His borrow'd purse. Well, Jessica, go in;

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Perhaps I will return immediately:

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Do as I bid you; shut doors after you:

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Fast bind, fast find;

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: A proverb never stale in thrifty mind.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Farewell; and if my fortune be not crost,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: I have a father, you a daughter, lost.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: This is the pent-house under which Lorenzo

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Desired us to make stand.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: SALARINO
line: His hour is almost past.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: And it is marvel he out-dwells his hour,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: For lovers ever run before the clock.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: SALARINO
line: O, ten times faster Venus' pigeons fly

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: SALARINO
line: To seal love's bonds new-made, than they are wont

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: SALARINO
line: To keep obliged faith unforfeited!

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: That ever holds: who riseth from a feast

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: With that keen appetite that he sits down?

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Where is the horse that doth untread again

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: His tedious measures with the unbated fire

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: That he did pace them first? All things that are,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Are with more spirit chased than enjoy'd.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: How like a younker or a prodigal

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: The scarfed bark puts from her native bay,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Hugg'd and embraced by the strumpet wind!

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: How like the prodigal doth she return,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: With over-weather'd ribs and ragged sails,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Lean, rent and beggar'd by the strumpet wind!

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Here comes Lorenzo: more of this hereafter.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Sweet friends, your patience for my long abode;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Not I, but my affairs, have made you wait:

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: When you shall please to play the thieves for wives,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: I'll watch as long for you then. Approach;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Here dwells my father Jew. Ho! who's within?

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Who are you? Tell me, for more certainty,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Albeit I'll swear that I do know your tongue.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Lorenzo, and thy love.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Lorenzo, certain, and my love indeed,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: For who love I so much? And now who knows

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: But you, Lorenzo, whether I am yours?

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Heaven and thy thoughts are witness that thou art.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Here, catch this casket; it is worth the pains.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: I am glad 'tis night, you do not look on me,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: For I am much ashamed of my exchange:

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: But love is blind and lovers cannot see

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: The pretty follies that themselves commit;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: For if they could, Cupid himself would blush

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: To see me thus transformed to a boy.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Descend, for you must be my torchbearer.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: What, must I hold a candle to my shames?

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: They in themselves, good-sooth, are too too light.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Why, 'tis an office of discovery, love;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: And I should be obscured.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: So are you, sweet,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Even in the lovely garnish of a boy.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: But come at once;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: For the close night doth play the runaway,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And we are stay'd for at Bassanio's feast.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: I will make fast the doors, and gild myself

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: JESSICA
line: With some more ducats, and be with you straight.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Now, by my hood, a Gentile and no Jew.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Beshrew me but I love her heartily;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: For she is wise, if I can judge of her,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And fair she is, if that mine eyes be true,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And true she is, as she hath proved herself,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And therefore, like herself, wise, fair and true,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Shall she be placed in my constant soul.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: What, art thou come? On, gentlemen; away!

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Our masquing mates by this time for us stay.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Who's there?

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Signior Antonio!

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Fie, fie, Gratiano! where are all the rest?

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: 'Tis nine o'clock: our friends all stay for you.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: No masque to-night: the wind is come about;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Bassanio presently will go aboard:

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I have sent twenty out to seek for you.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: I am glad on't: I desire no more delight

scene: SCENE VI.  The same.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Than to be under sail and gone to-night.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Go draw aside the curtains and discover

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: The several caskets to this noble prince.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Now make your choice.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: The first, of gold, who this inscription bears,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: 'Who chooseth me shall gain what many men desire;'

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: The second, silver, which this promise carries,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: 'Who chooseth me shall get as much as he deserves;'

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: This third, dull lead, with warning all as blunt,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: 'Who chooseth me must give and hazard all he hath.'

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: How shall I know if I do choose the right?

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: The one of them contains my picture, prince:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: If you choose that, then I am yours withal.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Some god direct my judgment! Let me see;

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: I will survey the inscriptions back again.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: What says this leaden casket?

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: 'Who chooseth me must give and hazard all he hath.'

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Must give: for what? for lead? hazard for lead?

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: This casket threatens. Men that hazard all

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Do it in hope of fair advantages:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: A golden mind stoops not to shows of dross;

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: I'll then nor give nor hazard aught for lead.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: What says the silver with her virgin hue?

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: 'Who chooseth me shall get as much as he deserves.'

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: As much as he deserves! Pause there, Morocco,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: And weigh thy value with an even hand:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: If thou be'st rated by thy estimation,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Thou dost deserve enough; and yet enough

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: May not extend so far as to the lady:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: And yet to be afeard of my deserving

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Were but a weak disabling of myself.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: As much as I deserve! Why, that's the lady:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: I do in birth deserve her, and in fortunes,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: In graces and in qualities of breeding;

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: But more than these, in love I do deserve.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: What if I stray'd no further, but chose here?

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Let's see once more this saying graved in gold

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: 'Who chooseth me shall gain what many men desire.'

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Why, that's the lady; all the world desires her;

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: From the four corners of the earth they come,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: To kiss this shrine, this mortal-breathing saint:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: The Hyrcanian deserts and the vasty wilds

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Of wide Arabia are as thoroughfares now

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: For princes to come view fair Portia:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: The watery kingdom, whose ambitious head

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Spits in the face of heaven, is no bar

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: To stop the foreign spirits, but they come,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: As o'er a brook, to see fair Portia.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: One of these three contains her heavenly picture.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Is't like that lead contains her? 'Twere damnation

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: To think so base a thought: it were too gross

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: To rib her cerecloth in the obscure grave.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Or shall I think in silver she's immured,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Being ten times undervalued to tried gold?

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: O sinful thought! Never so rich a gem

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Was set in worse than gold. They have in England

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: A coin that bears the figure of an angel

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Stamped in gold, but that's insculp'd upon;

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: But here an angel in a golden bed

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Lies all within. Deliver me the key:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Here do I choose, and thrive I as I may!

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: There, take it, prince; and if my form lie there,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Then I am yours.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: O hell! what have we here?

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: A carrion Death, within whose empty eye

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: There is a written scroll! I'll read the writing.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: All that glitters is not gold;

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Often have you heard that told:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Many a man his life hath sold

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: But my outside to behold:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Gilded tombs do worms enfold.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Had you been as wise as bold,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Young in limbs, in judgment old,

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Your answer had not been inscroll'd:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Fare you well; your suit is cold.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Cold, indeed; and labour lost:

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Then, farewell, heat, and welcome, frost!

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: Portia, adieu. I have too grieved a heart

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: MOROCCO
line: To take a tedious leave: thus losers part.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: A gentle riddance. Draw the curtains, go.

scene: SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Let all of his complexion choose me so.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Why, man, I saw Bassanio under sail:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: With him is Gratiano gone along;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And in their ship I am sure Lorenzo is not.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: The villain Jew with outcries raised the duke,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Who went with him to search Bassanio's ship.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: He came too late, the ship was under sail:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: But there the duke was given to understand

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: That in a gondola were seen together

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Lorenzo and his amorous Jessica:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Besides, Antonio certified the duke

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: They were not with Bassanio in his ship.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: I never heard a passion so confused,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: So strange, outrageous, and so variable,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: As the dog Jew did utter in the streets:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: 'My daughter! O my ducats! O my daughter!

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Fled with a Christian! O my Christian ducats!

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Justice! the law! my ducats, and my daughter!

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: A sealed bag, two sealed bags of ducats,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Of double ducats, stolen from me by my daughter!

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: And jewels, two stones, two rich and precious stones,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Stolen by my daughter! Justice! find the girl;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: She hath the stones upon her, and the ducats.'

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Why, all the boys in Venice follow him,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Crying, his stones, his daughter, and his ducats.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Let good Antonio look he keep his day,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Or he shall pay for this.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Marry, well remember'd.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: I reason'd with a Frenchman yesterday,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Who told me, in the narrow seas that part

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: The French and English, there miscarried

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: A vessel of our country richly fraught:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: I thought upon Antonio when he told me;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And wish'd in silence that it were not his.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: You were best to tell Antonio what you hear;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Yet do not suddenly, for it may grieve him.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: A kinder gentleman treads not the earth.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: I saw Bassanio and Antonio part:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Bassanio told him he would make some speed

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Of his return: he answer'd, 'Do not so;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Slubber not business for my sake, Bassanio

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: But stay the very riping of the time;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And for the Jew's bond which he hath of me,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Let it not enter in your mind of love:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Be merry, and employ your chiefest thoughts

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: To courtship and such fair ostents of love

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: As shall conveniently become you there:'

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And even there, his eye being big with tears,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Turning his face, he put his hand behind him,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: And with affection wondrous sensible

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: He wrung Bassanio's hand; and so they parted.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: I think he only loves the world for him.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: I pray thee, let us go and find him out

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: And quicken his embraced heaviness

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: With some delight or other.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Do we so.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Quick, quick, I pray thee; draw the curtain straight:

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: The Prince of Arragon hath ta'en his oath,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: And comes to his election presently.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Behold, there stand the caskets, noble prince:

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: If you choose that wherein I am contain'd,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Straight shall our nuptial rites be solemnized:

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: But if you fail, without more speech, my lord,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: You must be gone from hence immediately.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: I am enjoin'd by oath to observe three things:

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: First, never to unfold to any one

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Which casket 'twas I chose; next, if I fail

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Of the right casket, never in my life

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: To woo a maid in way of marriage: Lastly,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: If I do fail in fortune of my choice,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Immediately to leave you and be gone.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: To these injunctions every one doth swear

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: That comes to hazard for my worthless self.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: And so have I address'd me. Fortune now

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: To my heart's hope! Gold; silver; and base lead.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: 'Who chooseth me must give and hazard all he hath.'

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: You shall look fairer, ere I give or hazard.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: What says the golden chest? ha! let me see:

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: 'Who chooseth me shall gain what many men desire.'

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: What many men desire! that 'many' may be meant

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: By the fool multitude, that choose by show,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Not learning more than the fond eye doth teach;

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Which pries not to the interior, but, like the martlet,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Builds in the weather on the outward wall,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Even in the force and road of casualty.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: I will not choose what many men desire,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Because I will not jump with common spirits

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: And rank me with the barbarous multitudes.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Why, then to thee, thou silver treasure-house;

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Tell me once more what title thou dost bear:

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: 'Who chooseth me shall get as much as he deserves:'

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: And well said too; for who shall go about

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: To cozen fortune and be honourable

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Without the stamp of merit? Let none presume

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: To wear an undeserved dignity.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: O, that estates, degrees and offices

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Were not derived corruptly, and that clear honour

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Were purchased by the merit of the wearer!

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: How many then should cover that stand bare!

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: How many be commanded that command!

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: How much low peasantry would then be glean'd

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: From the true seed of honour! and how much honour

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Pick'd from the chaff and ruin of the times

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: To be new-varnish'd! Well, but to my choice:

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: 'Who chooseth me shall get as much as he deserves.'

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: I will assume desert. Give me a key for this,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: And instantly unlock my fortunes here.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Too long a pause for that which you find there.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: What's here? the portrait of a blinking idiot,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Presenting me a schedule! I will read it.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: How much unlike art thou to Portia!

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: How much unlike my hopes and my deservings!

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: 'Who chooseth me shall have as much as he deserves.'

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Did I deserve no more than a fool's head?

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Is that my prize? are my deserts no better?

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: To offend, and judge, are distinct offices

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And of opposed natures.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: What is here?

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: The fire seven times tried this:

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Seven times tried that judgment is,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: That did never choose amiss.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Some there be that shadows kiss;

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Such have but a shadow's bliss:

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: There be fools alive, I wis,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Silver'd o'er; and so was this.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Take what wife you will to bed,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: I will ever be your head:

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: So be gone: you are sped.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Still more fool I shall appear

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: By the time I linger here

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: With one fool's head I came to woo,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: But I go away with two.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Sweet, adieu. I'll keep my oath,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ARRAGON
line: Patiently to bear my wroth.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Thus hath the candle singed the moth.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: O, these deliberate fools! when they do choose,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: They have the wisdom by their wit to lose.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: The ancient saying is no heresy,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Hanging and wiving goes by destiny.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Come, draw the curtain, Nerissa.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: Where is my lady?

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Here: what would my lord?

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: Madam, there is alighted at your gate

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: A young Venetian, one that comes before

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: To signify the approaching of his lord;

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: From whom he bringeth sensible regreets,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: To wit, besides commends and courteous breath,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: Gifts of rich value. Yet I have not seen

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: So likely an ambassador of love:

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: A day in April never came so sweet,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: To show how costly summer was at hand,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: As this fore-spurrer comes before his lord.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: No more, I pray thee: I am half afeard

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Thou wilt say anon he is some kin to thee,

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Thou spend'st such high-day wit in praising him.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Come, come, Nerissa; for I long to see

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Quick Cupid's post that comes so mannerly.

scene: SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Bassanio, lord Love, if thy will it be!

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Now, what news on the Rialto?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Why, yet it lives there uncheck'd that Antonio hath

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: a ship of rich lading wrecked on the narrow seas;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: the Goodwins, I think they call the place; a very

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: dangerous flat and fatal, where the carcasses of many

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: a tall ship lie buried, as they say, if my gossip

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Report be an honest woman of her word.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: I would she were as lying a gossip in that as ever

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: knapped ginger or made her neighbours believe she

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: wept for the death of a third husband. But it is

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: true, without any slips of prolixity or crossing the

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: plain highway of talk, that the good Antonio, the

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: honest Antonio,--O that I had a title good enough

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: to keep his name company!--

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Come, the full stop.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Ha! what sayest thou? Why, the end is, he hath

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: lost a ship.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: I would it might prove the end of his losses.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Let me say 'amen' betimes, lest the devil cross my

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: prayer, for here he comes in the likeness of a Jew.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: How now, Shylock! what news among the merchants?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: You know, none so well, none so well as you, of my

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: daughter's flight.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: That's certain: I, for my part, knew the tailor

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: that made the wings she flew withal.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: And Shylock, for his own part, knew the bird was

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: fledged; and then it is the complexion of them all

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: to leave the dam.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: She is damned for it.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: That's certain, if the devil may be her judge.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: My own flesh and blood to rebel!

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALANIO
line: Out upon it, old carrion! rebels it at these years?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: I say, my daughter is my flesh and blood.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: There is more difference between thy flesh and hers

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: than between jet and ivory; more between your bloods

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: than there is between red wine and rhenish. But

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: tell us, do you hear whether Antonio have had any

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: loss at sea or no?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: There I have another bad match: a bankrupt, a

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: prodigal, who dare scarce show his head on the

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Rialto; a beggar, that was used to come so smug upon

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: the mart; let him look to his bond: he was wont to

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: call me usurer; let him look to his bond: he was

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: wont to lend money for a Christian courtesy; let him

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: look to his bond.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: Why, I am sure, if he forfeit, thou wilt not take

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SALARINO
line: his flesh: what's that good for?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.

line: To bait fish withal: if it will feed nothing else,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.

line: hindered me half a million; laughed at my losses,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: mocked at my gains, scorned my nation, thwarted my

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: bargains, cooled my friends, heated mine

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: enemies; and what's his reason? I am a Jew. Hath

speaker: SHYLOCK
line: not a Jew eyes? hath not a Jew hands, organs,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: the same food, hurt with the same weapons, subject

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: to the same diseases, healed by the same means,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: warmed and cooled by the same winter and summer, as

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: a Christian is? If you prick us, do we not bleed?

speaker: SHYLOCK

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: revenge? If we are like you in the rest, we will

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: resemble you in that. If a Jew wrong a Christian,

speaker: SHYLOCK

speaker: Servant
line: Gentlemen, my master Antonio is at his house and

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.

line: desires to speak with you both.

speaker: SALARINO
line: We have been up and down to seek him.

line: Here comes another of the tribe: a third cannot be

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.

line: matched, unless the devil himself turn Jew.

line: How now, Tubal! what news from Genoa? hast thou

line: I often came where I did hear of her, but cannot find her.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Why, there, there, there, there! a diamond gone,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: cost me two thousand ducats in Frankfort! The curse

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: never fell upon our nation till now; I never felt it

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: till now: two thousand ducats in that; and other

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: precious, precious jewels. I would my daughter

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: were dead at my foot, and the jewels in her ear!

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: would she were hearsed at my foot, and the ducats in

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: her coffin! No news of them? Why, so: and I know

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: not what's spent in the search: why, thou loss upon

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: loss! the thief gone with so much, and so much to

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: find the thief; and no satisfaction, no revenge:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: nor no in luck stirring but what lights on my

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: shoulders; no sighs but of my breathing; no tears

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: but of my shedding.

line: Yes, other men have ill luck too: Antonio, as I

line: heard in Genoa,--

line: What, what, what? ill luck, ill luck?

line: Hath an argosy cast away, coming from Tripolis.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: I thank God, I thank God. Is't true, is't true?

speaker: TUBAL
line: I spoke with some of the sailors that escaped the wreck.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: I thank thee, good Tubal: good news, good news!

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: ha, ha! where? in Genoa?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: TUBAL
line: Your daughter spent in Genoa, as I heard, in one

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: TUBAL

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Thou stickest a dagger in me: I shall never see my

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: gold again: fourscore ducats at a sitting!

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: fourscore ducats!

speaker: TUBAL
line: There came divers of Antonio's creditors in my

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.

line: company to Venice, that swear he cannot choose but break.

line: I am very glad of it: I'll plague him; I'll torture

speaker: SHYLOCK
line: him: I am glad of it.

line: One of them showed me a ring that he had of your

speaker: TUBAL

speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Out upon her! Thou torturest me, Tubal: it was my

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: turquoise; I had it of Leah when I was a bachelor:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: I would not have given it for a wilderness of monkeys.

line: But Antonio is certainly undone.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A street.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: Nay, that's true, that's very true. Go, Tubal, fee

line: me an officer; bespeak him a fortnight before. I

line: go, good Tubal; at our synagogue, Tubal.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I pray you, tarry: pause a day or two

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Before you hazard; for, in choosing wrong,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I lose your company: therefore forbear awhile.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: There's something tells me, but it is not love,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I would not lose you; and you know yourself,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Hate counsels not in such a quality.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: But lest you should not understand me well,--

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And yet a maiden hath no tongue but thought,--

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I would detain you here some month or two

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Before you venture for me. I could teach you

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: How to choose right, but I am then forsworn;

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: So will I never be: so may you miss me;

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: But if you do, you'll make me wish a sin,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: That I had been forsworn. Beshrew your eyes,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: They have o'erlook'd me and divided me;

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: One half of me is yours, the other half yours,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Mine own, I would say; but if mine, then yours,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And so all yours. O, these naughty times

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Put bars between the owners and their rights!

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And so, though yours, not yours. Prove it so,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Let fortune go to hell for it, not I.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I speak too long; but 'tis to peize the time,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: To eke it and to draw it out in length,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: To stay you from election.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Let me choose

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: For as I am, I live upon the rack.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Upon the rack, Bassanio! then confess

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: What treason there is mingled with your love.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: None but that ugly treason of mistrust,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Which makes me fear the enjoying of my love:

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: There may as well be amity and life

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: 'Tween snow and fire, as treason and my love.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Ay, but I fear you speak upon the rack,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Where men enforced do speak anything.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Promise me life, and I'll confess the truth.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Well then, confess and live.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: 'Confess' and 'love'

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Had been the very sum of my confession:

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: O happy torment, when my torturer

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Doth teach me answers for deliverance!

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: But let me to my fortune and the caskets.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Away, then! I am lock'd in one of them:

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: If you do love me, you will find me out.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Nerissa and the rest, stand all aloof.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Let music sound while he doth make his choice;

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Then, if he lose, he makes a swan-like end,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Fading in music: that the comparison

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: May stand more proper, my eye shall be the stream

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And watery death-bed for him. He may win;

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And what is music then? Then music is

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Even as the flourish when true subjects bow

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: To a new-crowned monarch: such it is

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: As are those dulcet sounds in break of day

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: That creep into the dreaming bridegroom's ear,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And summon him to marriage. Now he goes,

speaker: PORTIA
line: With no less presence, but with much more love,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Than young Alcides, when he did redeem

speaker: PORTIA
line: The virgin tribute paid by howling Troy

speaker: PORTIA
line: To the sea-monster: I stand for sacrifice

speaker: PORTIA
line: The rest aloof are the Dardanian wives,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: With bleared visages, come forth to view

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: The issue of the exploit. Go, Hercules!

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Live thou, I live: with much, much more dismay

speaker: PORTIA
line: I view the fight than thou that makest the fray.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Tell me where is fancy bred,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Or in the heart, or in the head?

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: How begot, how nourished?

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Reply, reply.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: It is engender'd in the eyes,

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: With gazing fed; and fancy dies

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: In the cradle where it lies.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Let us all ring fancy's knell

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I'll begin it,--Ding, dong, bell.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ALL
line: Ding, dong, bell.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: So may the outward shows be least themselves:

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: The world is still deceived with ornament.

scene: SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: In law, what plea so tainted and corrupt,
