line: Nay, take my life and all; pardon not that:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: You take my house when you do take the prop

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: That doth sustain my house; you take my life

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: When you do take the means whereby I live.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: What mercy can you render him, Antonio?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: A halter gratis; nothing else, for God's sake.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: So please my lord the duke and all the court

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: To quit the fine for one half of his goods,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I am content; so he will let me have

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: The other half in use, to render it,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Upon his death, unto the gentleman

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: That lately stole his daughter:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Two things provided more, that, for this favour,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: He presently become a Christian;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: The other, that he do record a gift,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Here in the court, of all he dies possess'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Unto his son Lorenzo and his daughter.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: DUKE
line: He shall do this, or else I do recant

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: DUKE
line: The pardon that I late pronounced here.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Art thou contented, Jew? what dost thou say?

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: I am content.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Clerk, draw a deed of gift.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: I pray you, give me leave to go from hence;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: I am not well: send the deed after me,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: SHYLOCK
line: And I will sign it.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: DUKE
line: Get thee gone, but do it.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: In christening shalt thou have two god-fathers:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Had I been judge, thou shouldst have had ten more,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: To bring thee to the gallows, not the font.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: DUKE
line: Sir, I entreat you home with me to dinner.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I humbly do desire your grace of pardon:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I must away this night toward Padua,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And it is meet I presently set forth.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: DUKE
line: I am sorry that your leisure serves you not.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: DUKE
line: Antonio, gratify this gentleman,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: DUKE
line: For, in my mind, you are much bound to him.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Most worthy gentleman, I and my friend

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Have by your wisdom been this day acquitted

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Of grievous penalties; in lieu whereof,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Three thousand ducats, due unto the Jew,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: We freely cope your courteous pains withal.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And stand indebted, over and above,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: In love and service to you evermore.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: He is well paid that is well satisfied;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And I, delivering you, am satisfied

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And therein do account myself well paid:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: My mind was never yet more mercenary.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I pray you, know me when we meet again:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I wish you well, and so I take my leave.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Dear sir, of force I must attempt you further:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Take some remembrance of us, as a tribute,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Not as a fee: grant me two things, I pray you,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Not to deny me, and to pardon me.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: You press me far, and therefore I will yield.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Give me your gloves, I'll wear them for your sake;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And, for your love, I'll take this ring from you:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Do not draw back your hand; I'll take no more;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And you in love shall not deny me this.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: This ring, good sir, alas, it is a trifle!

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I will not shame myself to give you this.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I will have nothing else but only this;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And now methinks I have a mind to it.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: There's more depends on this than on the value.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: The dearest ring in Venice will I give you,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And find it out by proclamation:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Only for this, I pray you, pardon me.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I see, sir, you are liberal in offers

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: You taught me first to beg; and now methinks

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: You teach me how a beggar should be answer'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Good sir, this ring was given me by my wife;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And when she put it on, she made me vow

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: That I should neither sell nor give nor lose it.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: That 'scuse serves many men to save their gifts.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: An if your wife be not a mad-woman,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And know how well I have deserved the ring,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: She would not hold out enemy for ever,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: PORTIA
line: For giving it to me. Well, peace be with you!

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: My Lord Bassanio, let him have the ring:

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Let his deservings and my love withal

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Be valued against your wife's commandment.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Go, Gratiano, run and overtake him;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Give him the ring, and bring him, if thou canst,

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Unto Antonio's house: away! make haste.

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Come, you and I will thither presently;

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And in the morning early will we both

scene: SCENE I.  Venice. A court of justice.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Fly toward Belmont: come, Antonio.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Inquire the Jew's house out, give him this deed

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And let him sign it: we'll away to-night

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And be a day before our husbands home:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: This deed will be well welcome to Lorenzo.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Fair sir, you are well o'erta'en

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: My Lord Bassanio upon more advice

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Hath sent you here this ring, and doth entreat

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Your company at dinner.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: That cannot be:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: His ring I do accept most thankfully:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And so, I pray you, tell him: furthermore,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I pray you, show my youth old Shylock's house.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: That will I do.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Sir, I would speak with you.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: NERISSA
line: I'll see if I can get my husband's ring,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Which I did make him swear to keep for ever.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Aside to NERISSA  Thou mayst, I warrant.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: We shall have old swearing

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: That they did give the rings away to men;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: But we'll outface them, and outswear them too.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Away! make haste: thou knowist where I will tarry.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A street.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Come, good sir, will you show me to this house?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: The moon shines bright: in such a night as this,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: When the sweet wind did gently kiss the trees

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And they did make no noise, in such a night

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Troilus methinks mounted the Troyan walls

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And sigh'd his soul toward the Grecian tents,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Where Cressid lay that night.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: In such a night

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Did Thisbe fearfully o'ertrip the dew

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: And saw the lion's shadow ere himself

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: And ran dismay'd away.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: In such a night

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Stood Dido with a willow in her hand

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Upon the wild sea banks and waft her love

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: To come again to Carthage.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: In such a night

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Medea gather'd the enchanted herbs

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: That did renew old AEson.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: In such a night

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Did Jessica steal from the wealthy Jew

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And with an unthrift love did run from Venice

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: As far as Belmont.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: In such a night

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Did young Lorenzo swear he loved her well,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: Stealing her soul with many vows of faith

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: And ne'er a true one.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: In such a night

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Did pretty Jessica, like a little shrew,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Slander her love, and he forgave it her.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: I would out-night you, did no body come;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: But, hark, I hear the footing of a man.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Who comes so fast in silence of the night?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: STEPHANO
line: A friend.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: A friend! what friend? your name, I pray you, friend?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: STEPHANO
line: Stephano is my name; and I bring word

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: STEPHANO
line: My mistress will before the break of day

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: STEPHANO
line: Be here at Belmont; she doth stray about

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: STEPHANO
line: By holy crosses, where she kneels and prays

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: STEPHANO
line: For happy wedlock hours.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Who comes with her?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: STEPHANO
line: None but a holy hermit and her maid.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: STEPHANO
line: I pray you, is my master yet return'd?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: He is not, nor we have not heard from him.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: But go we in, I pray thee, Jessica,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And ceremoniously let us prepare

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Some welcome for the mistress of the house.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Sola, sola! wo ha, ho! sola, sola!

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Who calls?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Sola! did you see Master Lorenzo?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Master Lorenzo, sola, sola!

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Leave hollaing, man: here.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Sola! where? where?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Here.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: Tell him there's a post come from my master, with

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: his horn full of good news: my master will be here

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LAUNCELOT
line: ere morning.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Sweet soul, let's in, and there expect their coming.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And yet no matter: why should we go in?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: My friend Stephano, signify, I pray you,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Within the house, your mistress is at hand;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And bring your music forth into the air.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: How sweet the moonlight sleeps upon this bank!

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Here will we sit and let the sounds of music

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Creep in our ears: soft stillness and the night

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Become the touches of sweet harmony.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Sit, Jessica. Look how the floor of heaven

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Is thick inlaid with patines of bright gold:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: There's not the smallest orb which thou behold'st

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: But in his motion like an angel sings,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Still quiring to the young-eyed cherubins;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Such harmony is in immortal souls;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: But whilst this muddy vesture of decay

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Doth grossly close it in, we cannot hear it.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Come, ho! and wake Diana with a hymn!

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: With sweetest touches pierce your mistress' ear,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And draw her home with music.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: JESSICA
line: I am never merry when I hear sweet music.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: The reason is, your spirits are attentive:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: For do but note a wild and wanton herd,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Or race of youthful and unhandled colts,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Fetching mad bounds, bellowing and neighing loud,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Which is the hot condition of their blood;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: If they but hear perchance a trumpet sound,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Or any air of music touch their ears,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: You shall perceive them make a mutual stand,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Their savage eyes turn'd to a modest gaze

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: By the sweet power of music: therefore the poet

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Did feign that Orpheus drew trees, stones and floods;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Since nought so stockish, hard and full of rage,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: But music for the time doth change his nature.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: The man that hath no music in himself,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Nor is not moved with concord of sweet sounds,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Is fit for treasons, stratagems and spoils;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: The motions of his spirit are dull as night

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: And his affections dark as Erebus:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Let no such man be trusted. Mark the music.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: That light we see is burning in my hall.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: How far that little candle throws his beams!

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: So shines a good deed in a naughty world.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: When the moon shone, we did not see the candle.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: So doth the greater glory dim the less:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: A substitute shines brightly as a king

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Unto the king be by, and then his state

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Empties itself, as doth an inland brook

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Into the main of waters. Music! hark!

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: It is your music, madam, of the house.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Nothing is good, I see, without respect:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Methinks it sounds much sweeter than by day.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Silence bestows that virtue on it, madam.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: The crow doth sing as sweetly as the lark,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: When neither is attended, and I think

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: The nightingale, if she should sing by day,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: When every goose is cackling, would be thought

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: No better a musician than the wren.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: How many things by season season'd are

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: To their right praise and true perfection!

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Peace, ho! the moon sleeps with Endymion

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And would not be awaked.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: That is the voice,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Or I am much deceived, of Portia.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: He knows me as the blind man knows the cuckoo,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: By the bad voice.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Dear lady, welcome home.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: We have been praying for our husbands' healths,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Which speed, we hope, the better for our words.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Are they return'd?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Madam, they are not yet;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: But there is come a messenger before,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: To signify their coming.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Go in, Nerissa;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Give order to my servants that they take

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: No note at all of our being absent hence;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Nor you, Lorenzo; Jessica, nor you.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Your husband is at hand; I hear his trumpet:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: We are no tell-tales, madam; fear you not.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: This night methinks is but the daylight sick;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: It looks a little paler: 'tis a day,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Such as the day is when the sun is hid.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: We should hold day with the Antipodes,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: If you would walk in absence of the sun.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Let me give light, but let me not be light;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: For a light wife doth make a heavy husband,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And never be Bassanio so for me:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: But God sort all! You are welcome home, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I thank you, madam. Give welcome to my friend.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: This is the man, this is Antonio,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: To whom I am so infinitely bound.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: You should in all sense be much bound to him.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: For, as I hear, he was much bound for you.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: No more than I am well acquitted of.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Sir, you are very welcome to our house:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: It must appear in other ways than words,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Therefore I scant this breathing courtesy.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: To NERISSA  By yonder moon I swear you do me wrong;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: In faith, I gave it to the judge's clerk:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Would he were gelt that had it, for my part,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Since you do take it, love, so much at heart.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: A quarrel, ho, already! what's the matter?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: About a hoop of gold, a paltry ring

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: That she did give me, whose posy was

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: For all the world like cutler's poetry

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Upon a knife, 'Love me, and leave me not.'

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: What talk you of the posy or the value?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: You swore to me, when I did give it you,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: That you would wear it till your hour of death

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: And that it should lie with you in your grave:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Though not for me, yet for your vehement oaths,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: You should have been respective and have kept it.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Gave it a judge's clerk! no, God's my judge,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: The clerk will ne'er wear hair on's face that had it.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: He will, an if he live to be a man.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Ay, if a woman live to be a man.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Now, by this hand, I gave it to a youth,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: A kind of boy, a little scrubbed boy,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: No higher than thyself; the judge's clerk,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: A prating boy, that begg'd it as a fee:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: I could not for my heart deny it him.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: You were to blame, I must be plain with you,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: To part so slightly with your wife's first gift:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: A thing stuck on with oaths upon your finger

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And so riveted with faith unto your flesh.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I gave my love a ring and made him swear

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Never to part with it; and here he stands;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I dare be sworn for him he would not leave it

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Nor pluck it from his finger, for the wealth

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: That the world masters. Now, in faith, Gratiano,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: You give your wife too unkind a cause of grief:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: An 'twere to me, I should be mad at it.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Aside  Why, I were best to cut my left hand off

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And swear I lost the ring defending it.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: My Lord Bassanio gave his ring away

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Unto the judge that begg'd it and indeed

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Deserved it too; and then the boy, his clerk,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: That took some pains in writing, he begg'd mine;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: And neither man nor master would take aught

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: But the two rings.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: What ring gave you my lord?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Not that, I hope, which you received of me.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: If I could add a lie unto a fault,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I would deny it; but you see my finger

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Hath not the ring upon it; it is gone.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Even so void is your false heart of truth.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: By heaven, I will ne'er come in your bed

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Until I see the ring.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Nor I in yours

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Till I again see mine.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Sweet Portia,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: If you did know to whom I gave the ring,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: If you did know for whom I gave the ring

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And would conceive for what I gave the ring

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And how unwillingly I left the ring,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: When nought would be accepted but the ring,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: You would abate the strength of your displeasure.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: If you had known the virtue of the ring,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Or half her worthiness that gave the ring,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Or your own honour to contain the ring,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: You would not then have parted with the ring.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: What man is there so much unreasonable,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: If you had pleased to have defended it

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: With any terms of zeal, wanted the modesty

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: To urge the thing held as a ceremony?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Nerissa teaches me what to believe:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I'll die for't but some woman had the ring.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: No, by my honour, madam, by my soul,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: No woman had it, but a civil doctor,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Which did refuse three thousand ducats of me

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And begg'd the ring; the which I did deny him

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And suffer'd him to go displeased away;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Even he that did uphold the very life

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Of my dear friend. What should I say, sweet lady?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I was enforced to send it after him;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I was beset with shame and courtesy;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: My honour would not let ingratitude

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: So much besmear it. Pardon me, good lady;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: For, by these blessed candles of the night,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Had you been there, I think you would have begg'd

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: The ring of me to give the worthy doctor.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Let not that doctor e'er come near my house:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Since he hath got the jewel that I loved,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And that which you did swear to keep for me,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I will become as liberal as you;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I'll not deny him any thing I have,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: No, not my body nor my husband's bed:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Know him I shall, I am well sure of it:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Lie not a night from home; watch me like Argus:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: If you do not, if I be left alone,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Now, by mine honour, which is yet mine own,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I'll have that doctor for my bedfellow.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: And I his clerk; therefore be well advised

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: How you do leave me to mine own protection.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Well, do you so; let not me take him, then;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: For if I do, I'll mar the young clerk's pen.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I am the unhappy subject of these quarrels.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Sir, grieve not you; you are welcome notwithstanding.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Portia, forgive me this enforced wrong;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: And, in the hearing of these many friends,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I swear to thee, even by thine own fair eyes,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Wherein I see myself--

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Mark you but that!

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: In both my eyes he doubly sees himself;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: In each eye, one: swear by your double self,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And there's an oath of credit.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Nay, but hear me:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Pardon this fault, and by my soul I swear

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: I never more will break an oath with thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I once did lend my body for his wealth;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Which, but for him that had your husband's ring,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Had quite miscarried: I dare be bound again,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: My soul upon the forfeit, that your lord

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Will never more break faith advisedly.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Then you shall be his surety. Give him this

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And bid him keep it better than the other.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Here, Lord Bassanio; swear to keep this ring.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: By heaven, it is the same I gave the doctor!

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I had it of him: pardon me, Bassanio;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: For, by this ring, the doctor lay with me.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: And pardon me, my gentle Gratiano;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: For that same scrubbed boy, the doctor's clerk,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: In lieu of this last night did lie with me.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Why, this is like the mending of highways

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: In summer, where the ways are fair enough:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: What, are we cuckolds ere we have deserved it?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Speak not so grossly. You are all amazed:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Here is a letter; read it at your leisure;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: It comes from Padua, from Bellario:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: There you shall find that Portia was the doctor,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Nerissa there her clerk: Lorenzo here

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Shall witness I set forth as soon as you

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And even but now return'd; I have not yet

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Enter'd my house. Antonio, you are welcome;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And I have better news in store for you

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Than you expect: unseal this letter soon;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: There you shall find three of your argosies

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Are richly come to harbour suddenly:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: You shall not know by what strange accident

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: I chanced on this letter.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I am dumb.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Were you the doctor and I knew you not?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Were you the clerk that is to make me cuckold?

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Ay, but the clerk that never means to do it,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Unless he live until he be a man.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: Sweet doctor, you shall be my bed-fellow:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: BASSANIO
line: When I am absent, then lie with my wife.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Sweet lady, you have given me life and living;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: For here I read for certain that my ships

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Are safely come to road.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: How now, Lorenzo!

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: My clerk hath some good comforts too for you.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: Ay, and I'll give them him without a fee.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: There do I give to you and Jessica,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: From the rich Jew, a special deed of gift,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: NERISSA
line: After his death, of all he dies possess'd of.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Fair ladies, you drop manna in the way

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: LORENZO
line: Of starved people.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: It is almost morning,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And yet I am sure you are not satisfied

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: Of these events at full. Let us go in;

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And charge us there upon inter'gatories,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: PORTIA
line: And we will answer all things faithfully.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Let it be so: the first inter'gatory

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: That my Nerissa shall be sworn on is,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Whether till the next night she had rather stay,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Or go to bed now, being two hours to day:

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: But were the day come, I should wish it dark,

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: That I were couching with the doctor's clerk.

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: Well, while I live I'll fear no other thing

scene: SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.
speaker: GRATIANO
line: So sore as keeping safe Nerissa's ring.
